requirements.summary: Replace all user-facing occurrences of the term "SLA" with alternative wording while keeping the existing 72-hour deadline/timer behavior unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: No visible UI text contains the substring "SLA" (case-insensitive) on the landing page, dashboards, complaint lists, and complaint detail views.
The landing page copy that currently says "72-hour SLA" / "72-hour SLA guarantee" is updated to an alternative phrase that does not include "SLA" (e.g., "72-hour response window").
The complaint metadata label "SLA Status" is updated to an alternative label that does not include "SLA" (e.g., "Deadline status" or "Response deadline").
The time remaining/overdue indicators continue to display as before (no changes to due dates, timers, escalation behavior, or status logic).

file_operations.description: Update landing page user-facing copy to remove the term "SLA" (e.g., replace "72-hour SLA guarantee" and the "2. 72-Hour SLA" step title) while keeping the communicated 72-hour response/deadline concept intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Change the complaint metadata label "SLA Status" to alternative wording (e.g., "Response deadline" / "Deadline status") without altering any dueAt usage, timer computations, or escalation semantics. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace dashboard copy mentioning "72-hour SLA" with equivalent alternative wording (e.g., "72-hour response window" / "72-hour deadline") while keeping the meaning and dashboard behavior unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
